title: Wrong Preseason Rewards?
body:
I quickly logged on this morning to check out the preseason content and noticed that I've only got the quest for the champion emote and not the conqueror but I've been playing since season 2 and expected to be much higher than 2500 hours. Could it be because of the server transfer that the hours I played on NA before OCE was available weren't included?

The other thing I noticed is that I don't have the quest for the Rune Page Ward Skin. Even though I was over the requirement by having heaps of tier 3 runes and 14 Runes pages. Would it be possible to have someone at Riot clarify this is correct?

replies.body:
Thanks for the info, I've sent a ticket into support. 

For the Rune Enthusiast were all rune pages considered to be worth 6300 IP regardless of how they were acquired? eg bought with RP, 2 for 1 deals, on sale etc?

Actually, when you transferred to OCE, did you buy a transfer after OCE went up for a while or did you take part in a free transfer when the server first went online?  If you took part in the free transfer, definitely let the agent helping you out know.  I don't know if OCE was affected, but we have had issues with transfers done upon server opening, especially for earlier servers.

> [{quoted}](name=Django UnJaned,realm=NA,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=jLiJX7yk,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2017-11-07T00:51:31.806+0000)
>
> Actually, when you transferred to OCE, did you buy a transfer after OCE went up for a while or did you take part in a free transfer when the server first went online?  If you took part in the free transfer, definitely let the agent helping you out know.  I don't know if OCE was affected, but we have had issues with transfers done upon server opening, especially for earlier servers.

Yea I was apart of the free transfer when it first went online

Nope, the enthusiast reward is calculated based on your total IP spent (except for RP rune pages, they count as 6300 IP each) instead of quantity owned (which is how the rune collector reward does it).  

Enthusiast - reward and acknowledge high spenders
Collector - proportionally reward ownership

I provided my full calculations to Riot Support of how I got to my total IP spent on Runes of 147,255. And the response was:

"I'm afraid that I won't be able to go into the details, however I double checked and what I can tell you is by the looks of it, you have not reached the 125k threshold."

Which is just not good enough. How can I escalate this further Django Unjaned?
Still trying to get a straight answer out of support.... This is very frustrating.
I'm having the same problem. Playing this game since season one. I didn't even know we got skins as veteran players until my friend told me about it. Really upset about this right now.

Hey Firetroll,

I checked your account and it looks like you didn't make the cut-off for the Rune Enthusiast (top rune spenders) nor the 2500 hr emote.  Very few players will make the highest threshold since we set it at a level that rewards the top 10-15%...and you'd be surprised at exactly how much people play and buy runes.   I'm not comfortable with posting the details of your account on this board, so if you'd like for someone to tell you how many hours you've played, and double-check that your transfer data went through correctly, your best bet is to send in a ticket with player support.

Hope you're enjoying the new runes in the meanwhile though!

hi Django UnJaned ï¼Œ

  i have similar enquires with firetroll, is that i had like 1x rune pages before, but wen i log in i have seen any reward at all, not sure if you could kindly have a look at that for me as well :( i paid and transfered to multiple regions for several times, not sure if that would be the reason? 

Thank you so mcuh

Hey XXXYX,  you don't get your rewards on log-in, but from completing the preseason reward missions (play a matchmade game, win or lose).  You'll get all of your rewards granted except your BE.  The Rune Collector missions grants Orbs that you have to open in Loot first.

Some players also have trouble finding their epic skins because sometimes the notification bugs out.  You can check them out by doing either of the following:
1. Click on the notification button (under the X For closing your client and above your friend's list) and open up any of the gifting events. You should see a pop-up with the epics you received.
2. Go to the Store > then click on "Account" (circular button next to the Purchase RP button) > Purchase History on the far left > Gifting History below purchase history
I may not have played enough for Conqueror, it's hard to gauge hours played. But I doubled checked my math for Enthusiast I definitely met the criteria.

I received both Conqueror and Enthusiast quests.

You just ain't nerd enough firetroll.

So say I bought the 12 rune pages with RP that would count as 6300 x 12 = 75,600 towards the required 125,000 for the Rune Enthusiast ward. So I would have only needed to spend 49,400 on other runes to meet the requirement. When I did my calculations I was around 60k IP spent on runes. 

This is where my confusion is coming from because by my calculation I should be above the 125,000 mark for IP spent
